body_html:
currently the official / supported solution for mobile is pytorch -> ONNX -> {Caffe2/CoreML/nnapi}.

Even if libtorch does compile for Android (which it does, i'll get to that in a sec), it's not really optimized for ARM64 right now, and the binary size will be pretty large.

That being said, @t-vi wants to take a crack at porting libtorch to run with android ndk. Read https://lernapparat.de/pytorch-android/ for more details.

cc: @dreiss

That being said, @t-vi wants to take a crack at porting libtorch to run with android ndk. Read https://lernapparat.de/pytorch-android/ for more details.

body:
currently the official / supported solution for mobile is `pytorch -> ONNX -> {Caffe2/CoreML/nnapi}`.

Even if libtorch does compile for Android (which it does, i'll get to that in a sec), it's not really optimized for ARM64 right now, and the binary size will be pretty large.

That being said, @t-vi wants to take a crack at porting libtorch to run with android ndk. Read https://lernapparat.de/pytorch-android/ for more details.

cc: @dreiss
